card.description:
by WorldTribune Staff, October 1, 2021

Attorney Sidney Powell announced last week that her legal team had been granted the opportunity by a Colorado court to depose Dominion Voting Systems security director Eric Coomer.

Powell‚Äôs team was granted questions in a deposition on Sept. 23. Coomer was reportedly deposed for about an hour.

But, thanks to Judge Marie Avery Moses, Coomer‚Äôs testimony has yet to be revealed. One day after the deposition, Judge Moses issued a protective order, effectively sealing the transcript.

A source told Gateway Pundit: ‚ÄúThe Judge issued this order sua sponte, which means that no one asked her to do this. She just did it on her own the day after Coomer gave a train-wreck deposition in which he was very clearly emotionally unstable, arrogant, and repeatedly failed to give direct answers to questions. He was clearly playing games and his testimony is simply not credible.‚Äù

Coomer sued several Trump supporters, media outlets and media personalities following the 2020 presidential election, including Powell, Rudy Giuliani, Michelle Malkin, Joe Oltmann, The Gateway Pundit and Jim Hoft, among others.

The media is now blocked from downloading Coomer‚Äôs testimony.

Judge Moses ruled that Coomer‚Äôs deposition ‚Äúshould be protected from disclosure outside of these proceedings at this time and until otherwise modified by subsequent order of the Court.‚Äù

In early October of 2020, a week before early voting started in Georgia, 11 Alive news reported that Dominion updated all the voting machines in the state: The state told us last week that the update was routine. But the sheer scope of the update of the state‚Äôs 34,000 or so voting machines is what‚Äôs raising eyebrows. The biggest update occurred last week at Fulton County‚Äôs voter warehouse in northwest Atlanta. Critics have filed suit to scuttle the voting machine because they say the update is more than Georgia‚Äôs 159 counties can safely handle.

Gateway Pundit reported at the time that Coomer was the individual who updated the machines.

In GA, during (late?) Sept, Dominion‚Äôs radical Leftist Eric Coomer made a ‚Äúcritical software change‚Äù to GA‚Äôs Dominion voting machines ‚Äúwithout adequate testing or certification from the U.S. Election Assistance Commission‚Äù. From this 9/29/20 AJC story https://t.co/Mhn8wIcewK pic.twitter.com/GtpN1SzOXF

Kaufmann himself is a ‚Äúrainbow person‚Äù of (ahem) mixed descent:

>[Eric Kaufmann was born in Hong Kong and raised in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada and Japan. His ancestry is mixed with a quarter Chinese and a quarter Latino. His father Steve Kaufmann is of Jewish descent. The grandfather a secularist hailing from Prostejov in the modern Czech Republic.]<

Can you say rootless cosmopolitan? Can you say race bastard?

That‚Äôs not a strong brew of blood, that‚Äôs an unholy witch‚Äôs brew of amalgamation. Something sure is clogged at the bottom of that gene pool. Yes, sir, that‚Äôs a genetic heritage from all and sundry; it makes a hybrid look whole. If you look carefully you can see it in his face, the faint hint of something akin to fetal alcohol syndrome.

And, not surprisingly, this medley and potpourri of blood tells loudly in his work. Genetics is destiny, after all.

And not only is he of mixed descent, his thinking is mixed-up too. But that‚Äôs not surprising in the least, for like that miscegenating anti-CRT crusader Christopher Rufo, Kaufmann poses as a moderate friend to the White man ‚Äî but is in fact our most dangerous and mortal enemy. He want to propitiate it and appease it in order to disarm it. He concedes a few trivial points in order to forestall the lot.

* * *

Kaufmann wrote a halfway decent book on America back in 2004 called The Rise and Fall of Anglo America. In it he traces the sorry demise of the core group of the Old America. His main thesis is roughly correct: That from its beginnings, White America already contained the seeds of its ultimate destruction. He called the Old America‚Äôs mode of being ‚Äúdouble-consciousness‚Äù ‚Äî meaning that early White leaders and intellectuals in America never doubted for a moment that this was an Anglo-Saxon nation; but alongside that they also always spoke in universal terms, that America was an ‚Äúasylum of the nations.‚Äù In the end, the latter eclipsed the former.

And now we are just an asylum.

In 2019 he came out with his mega-ton academic blockbuster ‚Äî a book called Whiteshift, subtitled Populism, Immigration, and the Future of White Majorities.

His main idea is the perennial canard that White is a culture, not a race. He approves of the former and scorns ‚Äî and is frightened witless ‚Äî by the latter.(...)

_source.contentraw:
The Family Dynamics Of Democrat Annoyance With The White Working Class

Steve Sailer 12/13/2021

A friend writes:

White Americans, and specifically the white working class, are to the Democratic Party the now embarrassing and superfluous children from a previous marriage. The one they had with the ‚Äústarter wife.‚Äù The marriage from before they had made it and had to make cringe compromises.

Immigrants and POC are the children they‚Äôre proud to have now with their second wife. They represent the future and the true genealogical line they tend to like a garden. They are to be spoiled and they have anxiety that they get into the best schools and live up to their potential.

Or maybe Democrats see the white working class as their ex-stepchildren that their ex-wife brought from a previous marriage. But to perfect the analogy, we‚Äôd have to figure out a way the ex-stepchildren have to send financial support to the new children.

A lot of the Democratic Party‚Äôs ill feelings towards the white working class is resentment, of having had to have put up with them in some sort of vague Marxist worship of the working classes. But ill will is also out of a sense of guilt. They need to hate the white working class out of guilt for replacing them in their coalition.

‚ÄúThe most effective way to silence our guilty conscience is to convince ourselves and others that those we have sinned against are indeed depraved creatures, deserving every punishment, even extermination. We cannot pity those we have wronged, nor can we be indifferent toward them. We must hate and persecute them or else leave the door open to self-contempt.‚Äù ‚Äì Eric Hoffer, The True Believer

Schumer, Who Accused Trump of Russian Collusion, is Getting Paid by Putin
So is every top Democrat who accused President Trump of Russian collusion.
Dec 13, 2021 - Daniel Greenfield A single, ominous question now hangs over the White House: What could possibly cause President Trump to put the interests of Russia over those of the United States?‚Äù Senator Schumer insinuated in 2018.

Why is Schumer putting Russia‚Äôs interests ahead of those of the United States by blocking Nord Stream 2 sanctions on Putin‚Äôs pet pipeline into Europe?

Schumer, along with a number of other top Democrats, is a beneficiary of campaign contributionsfrom top Democrat fundraiser Vincent Roberti whose lobbying firm was paid over $8.5 million by Nord Stream 2 which is owned by Putin's state-run Gazprom energy monopoly.

Roberti, a former Dem politician, has maxed out his donations to Schumer and to Rep. Eric Swalwell, who may have been cheating on Fang Fang with Vladimir, and threw in a generous $171,000 to the DCCC, as part of the over $545,000 donated to the Democrat political machine.

The top Dem bundler is reportedly lobbying on ‚Äúissues related to the U.S. position toward the Nord Stream 2 pipeline, including potential financial sanctions affecting the project.‚Äù

Suddenly, Schumer, who was accusing the GOP and Trump of being in bed with Putin, and demanding that they vote on sanctions, was refusing to hold a floor vote on Russia sanctions.

‚ÄúMillions of Americans will continue to wonder if the only possible explanation for this dangerous behavior is the possibility that President Putin holds damaging information over President Trump,‚Äù Schumer had smeared back then. What damaging info does Putin have on Chuck?

President Trump, at the time, had urged that, ‚Äúwe should start an immediate investigation‚Äù into Schumer‚Äôs ties with Russia, and described him as a ‚Äútotal hypocrite‚Äù. That is an understatement. https://www.frontpagemag.com/fpm/2021/12/schumer-who-accused-trump-russian-collusion-daniel-greenfield/

_source.contentraw:
Missouri

"Accusing Missouri Attorney General Eric Schmitt of creating ‚Äúchaos‚Äù across the state with what they call a ‚Äúcampaign of litigation terror,‚Äù Jackson and St. Louis counties filed a legal action late Monday afternoon aimed at overturning a court order Schmitt has relied on to challenge local health regulations.

That court order by a Cole County judge last month invalidated numerous regulations of the state Department of Health and Senior Services. And it stripped local health departments of several legal powers to order measures to control the spread of the coronavirus that causes COVID-19.

Jackson and St. Louis counties seek to appeal the ruling or ask for a new trial. If an appeal is granted, they ask that the ruling be stayed pending the outcome.

‚ÄúChaos now reigns in the State with respect to the administration of public health,‚Äù the counties say in a memorandum supporting their motion to intervene and stay enforcement of the Cole County judge‚Äôs ruling. ‚ÄúFew public health officials, local government leaders, and school boards have any idea what they are legally permitted to do or are legally prohibited from doing.‚Äù

The ruling stems from a lawsuit filed last January by a St. Louis-area resident, a church and a bar in Chesterfield that had opposed dining restrictions then in effect in St. Louis County.

They challenged local public health measures indirectly by questioning the lawfulness of certain state health regulations.

According to Jackson and St. Louis counties, Cole County Circuit Judge Daniel Green went beyond what he was asked to do when he issued his summary judgment.

Green said DHSS did not have the authority to ‚Äúpermit naked lawmaking by bureaucrats across Missouri.‚Äù Even though most mask mandates and capacity restrictions had been lifted at the time of his ruling, Green barred health departments from making any future rules, including quarantine requirements for school children.

‚ÄúThis case is about whether Missouri‚Äôs Department of Health and Senior Services can abolish representative government in the creation of public health laws, and whether it can authorize closure of a school or assembly based on the unfettered opinion of an unelected official,‚Äù Green wrote. ‚ÄúThis Court finds it cannot.‚Äù

https://www.kansascity.com/news/politics-government/article256571576.html

It was created by artists Casey Sorrow and Eric Millikin, when they were students at Michigan State University in 2000. It apparently caught on, due to online publishing of the creators' artwork. It is Roast Chestnuts Day, it is that time of year. Seasonal. And it is National  Bouillabaisse Day, which is not really national or native to America. group.description:
What a great way to start your day. Say good morning to your gab family here so that your "good morning" posts are in one place, easy to find. 
Remember: Gab's promise of legal free-speech is always only one click away. While you're in this group, please follow the guidelines.
1. Please post in English. 
2. No solicitations of funds. 
3. No selling of products or services. 
4. Don't promote your group while you are in my group.
5. No blatant political posts; avoid mentioning political parties or ideologies.
6. No purely or primarily religious posts and no religious verses.
7. Not more than two or three posts per day; and not at the same time. 
8. Please do not use the "Quote" feature on a post that is inside this group, when a "comment" on the original post is possible.
9. Please do not include member @ names in your original post or add additional @ names to your comments. 
10. Vulgar language or images and messages designed to spur argument are unwelcome. 

Posts that do not follow the guidelines, or otherwise seem inappropriate for the group, will be removed from the group. Depending upon circumstances, offenders may be banned from the group.

Each guideline has a reason behind it, and is intended to keep this group a place for friendly exchanges between members. As part of your greeting, family-friendly photos, videos, GIFs, links, short stories about your morning, your day, or your life are all welcome. 

Let‚Äôs keep the "Good Morning" Brigade, the friendliest place on the internet.

So is every top Democrat who accused President Trump of Russian collusion.
Why is Schumer putting Russia‚Äôs interests ahead of those of the United States by blocking Nord Stream 2 sanctions on Putin‚Äôs pet pipeline into Europe?

Schumer, along with a number of other top Democrats, is a beneficiary of campaign contributions from top Democrat fundraiser Vincent Roberti whose lobbying firm was paid over $8.5 million by Nord Stream 2 which is owned by Putin's state-run Gazprom energy monopoly.

Roberti, a former Dem politician, has maxed out his donations to Schumer and to Rep. Eric Swalwell, who may have been cheating on Fang Fang with Vladimir, and threw in a generous $171,000 to the DCCC, as part of the over $545,000 donated to the Democrat political machine.

The top Dem bundler is reportedly lobbying on ‚Äúissues related to the U.S. position toward the Nord Stream 2 pipeline, including potential financial sanctions affecting the project.‚Äù

Suddenly, Schumer, who was accusing the GOP and Trump of being in bed with Putin, and demanding that they vote on sanctions, was refusing to hold a floor vote on Russia sanctions.

‚ÄúMillions of Americans will continue to wonder if the only possible explanation for this dangerous behavior is the possibility that President Putin holds damaging information over President Trump,‚Äù Schumer had smeared back then. What damaging info does Putin have on Chuck?

President Trump, at the time, had urged that, ‚Äúwe should start an immediate investigation‚Äù into Schumer‚Äôs ties with Russia, and described him as a ‚Äútotal hypocrite‚Äù. That is an understatement.

Three years ago, Schumer was clamoring that putting off sanctions on Russia, ‚Äúis an extreme dereliction of duty by President Trump, who seems more intent on undermining the rule of law of this country than standing up to Putin.‚Äù That describes Schumer in a nutshell. https://www.frontpagemag.com/fpm/2021/12/schumer-who-accused-trump-russian-collusion-daniel-greenfield/

Le fondateur de SpaceX, Elon Musk, a r√©v√©l√© que son entreprise travaillait sur un programme visant √† retirer le CO2 de l'atmosph√®re en le transformant en carburant pour fus√©e - affirmant que le programme sera important pour sa mission vers Mars.
Musk a annonc√© le programme sur les m√©dias sociaux lundi, en tweetant : "SpaceX lance un programme pour retirer le CO2 de l'atmosph√®re et le transformer en carburant pour fus√©e. Rejoignez-nous si vous √™tes int√©ress√©s... Ce programme sera √©galement important pour Mars."

L'astrophysicien YouTuber Scott Manley a r√©agi en disant que si "faire cela a d√©j√† √©t√© d√©montr√©", convertir le CO2 pour alimenter les Starships de Musk "est un tout autre niveau." Le r√©dacteur en chef de l'espace d'Ars Technica, Eric Berger, a toutefois reconnu qu'un tel programme permettrait de "r√©pondre √† la pr√©occupation croissante des impacts climatiques des lancements de fus√©es."

Les v√©hicules Starship de Musk, enti√®rement r√©utilisables, sont construits dans l'intention d'explorer un jour Mars. Le milliardaire a affirm√© l'ann√©e derni√®re que SpaceX essaierait d'envoyer sa premi√®re mission non habit√©e sur Mars en 2022, et la premi√®re mission habit√©e en 2026 - ou 2024 "si nous avons de la chance".

Selon SpaceX, le Starship sera propuls√© par une fus√©e d'appoint, qui reviendra sur Terre lorsque le vaisseau entrera en orbite. En orbite, il sera ravitaill√© par un vaisseau de carburant, qui reviendra ensuite √©galement sur Terre, alors que le vaisseau se dirige vers Mars pour un voyage de six mois. Sur Mars, les vaisseaux seront ravitaill√©s √† l'aide de "ressources locales", selon l'entreprise, avant de revenir sur Terre pour √™tre r√©utilis√©s.

Cependant, tout le monde ne survivra pas au voyage vers Mars. Au d√©but de l'ann√©e, Musk avait pr√©venu : "Vous risquez de ne pas revenir vivant. Mais c'est une aventure glorieuse, et ce sera une exp√©rience incroyable".

_source.content: Minneapolis mayor calls police conduct during George Floyd protests 'galling' after video shows officers beating man."The most recent video footage that we saw ... is antithetical to everything that we should be pushing for in our police department," Jacob Frey said.The mayor of Minneapolis said recently released video footage of police conduct during protests over the death of George Floyd is "galling."Mayor Jacob Frey made the comment in a Facebook video message on Thursday, days after new videos were released that show Minneapolis officers talking about "hunting" people who were out past curfew during protests last year, and beating a man who had surrendered."The most recent video footage that we saw showing use of force, I think is antithetical to everything that we should be pushing for in our police department," Frey said.The videos were released as part of a case involving Jaleel Stallings, who was charged with shooting at officers in a white unmarked van after they fired a rubber bullet at him.Stallings, who was hit in the chest by the round, had a permit to carry the firearm in public, the Star Tribune reported.He testified at trial that he thought he was being attacked by civilians and fired three shots toward the van as a warning before taking cover behind his truck. No officers were hit.Jaleel Stallings in body camera footage released by his attorney.Jaleel Stallings in body camera footage released by his attorney.Minneapolis Police DepartmentWhen he realized he had shot at police, Stallings surrendered, according to his attorney, Eric Rice. Stallings was acquitted of the charges filed against him.In videos obtained by NBC affiliate KARE of Minneapolis, officers are seen pilling into the van to enforce a curfew put in place following days of unrest and violence in the wake of Floyd's death on May 25, 2020.Frey said in his video message that he wanted to ensure there is transparency in the investigative process, calling it "complex." He said that the Minneapolis Civil Rights Department has to gather evidence and conduct interviews to build a thorough case.The mayor said the process has been complicated because a lot of the involved officers who could have been potentially disciplined or terminated have already left the police department, some through resignations and others through retirement.Other officers are currently on leave and are being advised by their attorneys not to participate in an interview with the Civil Rights Department, the mayor said."If we can't participate in an interview process, it's difficult for us to gather evidence and information. If we can't gather the necessary evidence and information, then we're not put in a position where we could actually get the decision upheld. So that adds to the complexity once again," Frey said.
_source.contentraw:
Minneapolis mayor calls police conduct during George Floyd protests 'galling' after video shows officers beating man."The most recent video footage that we saw ... is antithetical to everything that we should be pushing for in our police department," Jacob Frey said.The mayor of Minneapolis said recently released video footage of police conduct during protests over the death of George Floyd is "galling."

Mayor Jacob Frey made the comment in a Facebook video message on Thursday, days after new videos were released that show Minneapolis officers talking about "hunting" people who were out past curfew during protests last year, and beating a man who had surrendered.

"The most recent video footage that we saw showing use of force, I think is antithetical to everything that we should be pushing for in our police department," Frey said.

The videos were released as part of a case involving Jaleel Stallings, who was charged with shooting at officers in a white unmarked van after they fired a rubber bullet at him.

Stallings, who was hit in the chest by the round, had a permit to carry the firearm in public, the Star Tribune reported.

He testified at trial that he thought he was being attacked by civilians and fired three shots toward the van as a warning before taking cover behind his truck. No officers were hit.

Jaleel Stallings in body camera footage released by his attorney.
Jaleel Stallings in body camera footage released by his attorney.Minneapolis Police Department
When he realized he had shot at police, Stallings surrendered, according to his attorney, Eric Rice. Stallings was acquitted of the charges filed against him.

In videos obtained by NBC affiliate KARE of Minneapolis, officers are seen pilling into the van to enforce a curfew put in place following days of unrest and violence in the wake of Floyd's death on May 25, 2020.



Frey said in his video message that he wanted to ensure there is transparency in the investigative process, calling it "complex." He said that the Minneapolis Civil Rights Department has to gather evidence and conduct interviews to build a thorough case.

The mayor said the process has been complicated because a lot of the involved officers who could have been potentially disciplined or terminated have already left the police department, some through resignations and others through retirement.

Other officers are currently on leave and are being advised by their attorneys not to participate in an interview with the Civil Rights Department, the mayor said.

"If we can't participate in an interview process, it's difficult for us to gather evidence and information. If we can't gather the necessary evidence and information, then we're not put in a position where we could actually get the decision upheld. So that adds to the complexity once again," Frey said.

This is beyond damning:

Milo Yiannopoulos is actively collaborating both with the litigants in Sines v. Kessler, but also with the Federal Bureau of Investigation, recently released court documents reveal.

Your knee-jerk response might be: who cares about Milo anymore? Why is he still relevant?

In early 2019, you‚Äôd be right- by that point he had been relegated to posting on Telegram and making the occasional YouTube video.

That fall from relevance was interrupted, however, in 2019, when an effort to ‚Äúrehabilitate‚Äù Milo began. He was granted interviews, given favorable coverage, and given a home within the ‚Äúgroyper movement.‚Äù He was even invited, by Nicholas J. Fuentes, to do ‚Äúvery helpful‚Äù work ‚Äúbehind the scenes.‚Äù

Things have happened over the last two years- admissions, leaks, doxings, meetings- that didn‚Äôt seem connected at the time. They could be explained as isolated incidents, or perhaps as moments of irony.

In light of Milo‚Äôs admitted position as a federal informant, re-examination reveals these events may be more connected than originally thought.

In this piece, we will explore not only Milo‚Äôs history of blackmailing dissidents and his relationship with Roberta Kaplan and the FBI- but the ‚Äúdissident right‚Äù figures that knowingly advanced an admitted blackmailer to the forefront of their movement, endangering many people along the way.

Sines v. Kessler
Nearly three years after the Unite The Right demonstrations in Charlottesville, the event continues to be litigated in Sines v. Kessler. The purpose of this lawsuit, as stated by plaintiff‚Äôs counsel, is to ‚Äúbankrupt‚Äù white activists and make pro-white advocacy impossible.

Roberta Kaplan, plaintiff‚Äôs lead counsel, used this analogy for her work:

Maybe we‚Äôre in Germany in the early 1930s; there are certainly parallels‚Äîbut we now have the ability to do something about this. As a very, very proud Jew, I believe very strongly that we need to fight back‚Äînot in the streets, not using violence‚Äîbut fight back using the courts‚Ä¶My Judaism influences every single thing I do all day long.

For full coverage of Sines v. Kessler, we recommend Eric Striker‚Äôs National Justice.

As we come to find, videos leaked from Milo‚Äôs ‚Äúvault‚Äù have been ‚Äúhighly relevant material to the plaintiffs'‚Äù claims.
